page.title: 10Thornhill Auction Mart.
page.content: Thornhill Auction is situated a mile out of Thornhill.It has only one selling ring which is in the shape of an octagon. It has 7 decks of seats for spectators.It is held on Saturdays from August to November.A few of the buyers come from further afield but most of them are from local farms.The animals bought and sold are lambs from hill farms,Blue Headed Leicester, Suffolk etc.Also a small amount of surplus cattle.In spring the special is store cattle which are bought by lowland farmers to be fattened. Most farmers buy animals for prices around the average which are approximately: per lamb_Â£30,per ewe_Â£80, per bullock_Â£130 per kilo, per heifer _Â£100 per kilo. As long as sheep and cattle are kept in the area there will be a need for this market. YOJNE05440174
